News and Announcements

  1. Judge Rules for East Hampton in Montauk Jetty Lawsuit; Reverses Jury Award

    Please click on the press release below for further information. Click here for full press release

  2. NYSHIP Enrollees Can Now Pay Health and Dental Insurance Premiums Online

    Read on...

  3. South Fork Commuter Connection Rail-Shuttle Service Starts

    The first South Fork Commuter Connection trains will roll on Monday, March 4. A coordinated rail and bus system that will operate during peak commuting hours, it will provide East Hampton workers with a public transportation option. Read on...

  4. Urge Fed Action on H2-B Visas, In Support of EH Businesses

    In support of businesses in need of seasonal workers, Town Supervisor Peter Van Scoyoc and the East Hampton Town Board call on federal officials to act on H2-B Visa Program Read on...

  5. EH Town Financial Department Recognized

    Consecutive awards for excellence in financial reporting Read on...

  6. Ordinance Department Overview 2019

    Don Kauth, the head of East Hampton Town's Ordinance Enforcement Department, presented an overview of the department's functions and goals at a recent town board meeting Click Here for the Report

  7. Hamlet Study Process Continues

    Guides for Future of Town's Commercial Areas on Town Board Agenda for February 19; Frequently Asked Questions on Hamlet Planning Answered Additional Info...

  8. Town of East Hampton Introduces Wellness 60+

    A free exercise program for seniors aged 60 and up at Ashawagh Hall in Springs will include sessions in Qi Gong beginning on February 11 and Core Strength classes beginning on February 13. Additional Info...

  9. Funding Available for Eco-Friendly Septic Systems

    Help protect our drinking water, surface waters, harbors, and bays. Grants and rebates totaling up to $46,000 are available to East Hampton residents and business owners for the installation of low-nitrogen septic systems. Read on...

  10. Farm Dust Reduced in Amagansett; Soil Test Shows No Health Hazards

    Cooperative effort between East Hampton Town and Amagansett farmer and landowner addressed a dust issue in the hamlet by covering windblown fields with straw. Town-ordered soil tests found no pesticides; all metals found are at levels below state standard Read Press Release....

  11. New NY State Law Requires Smoke Alarm Upgrades by April 1, 2019

    Additional Info...

  12. Solarize East Hampton Extended into 2019; Discounts on Solar Panels for East Hampton Residents

    Click Here To Read More
